author: pbr
title: awesome sensor
review:
Remember gravity?

Well, it affects this sensor.  You can tell which way is up.

When it's in freefall you'll get 0/0/0

It took a lot of thought, but I came up with a NXT-G "virtual instrument" called a value absorber that works well when connected to the outputs of this sensor.

You can combine this sensor with a value-absorbing "myblock" and get reports of changes +/- in the various x/y/z directions rather than caring what the actual value is.

So with that, you can build something that'll tell you the sensor got moved left, or right, or forward, or back, or up, or down.

That's very useful.
